channel.title: Anyone know how to make a webclient?
channel.description:
Hello, so i have been working on making a minecraft webclient but i keep gettin an error when trying to load it, im so close to getting it to work but for some reason it just wont load the game, ill post a screenshot of the error and hopefully someone can help!
[IMG]http://img843.imageshack.us/img843/4492/helpmet.png[/img][/URL]

item.title: Anyone know how to make a webclient?
item.dc:creator: @k4den k4den
item.description:
@k4den wrote:

Why don’t you just make your own Auth system…
It only took me about an hour in total to make mine, and it would be so much easier then trying to generate a username or anything like that… All you would need to do is intergrate it with a forum system like SMF or something, and hey presto, a full Auth system, registration system and forum all in one =P

Maybe I should just write a tutorial for that or something…

Read full topic

@Wildyscape562 wrote:

[code]

body { background-image:url('1.jpeg'); background-repeat:no-repeat; background-position:center; }

Wayne's Minecraft Webclient.
Enter Your Desired Username (please no spaces or strange characters).
We will not keep track of your usernames, create a bookmark when prompted. Username:











Site Created by Wayne Goodall
[/code]

That is the code from what sinfulkillers website uses for the username creation, need to get userentry.php to do so

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I guess on that note I’ll just post the source to my PHP page here. Demo of the page, using the name ADSL:

Free Web Hosting

Free Web Hosting - Your Website need to be migrated

Absolutely Free Web Hosting with PHP, MySQL, cPanel and no Ads!

<?php
$user = $_GET['user']
?>
<html>
 <body>
  <center>
   <head>
    <style>
     body {
            background-image: url("dirt.png")
        }
    </style>
   </head>
    <applet code="net.minecraft.Launcher" archive="https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/launcher/MinecraftLauncher.jar?v=1303302694000" width="100%" height="100%">
    <param name="separate_jvm" value="true">   
    <param name="java_arguments" value="-Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -Dsun.awt.noerasebackground=true -Dsun.java2d.d3d=false -Dsun.java2d.opengl=false -Dsun.java2d.pmoffscreen=false -Xms512M -Xmx512M">
    <param name="userName" value=<?php echo $user ?>>   
    <param name="latestVersion" value="1303302694000">   
    <param name="downloadTicket" value="1d1d3888da375267c377de82a5e8ff99">
    <param name="sessionId" value="2095002344773593704">
   </applet>
  </center>
 </body>
</html>

item.title: Anyone know how to make a webclient?
item.dc:creator: @k4den k4den
item.description:
@k4den wrote:

you should be able to use PHP to get the persons username and parse it as parameters to the applet using $_GET
just make a simple form. make them enter a username + password or something, and then it will check a database to see if it matches, THEN if it has verified the person, it could just send you to another page(probably using post parameters as apposed to get)…

psudocode:

username = input;
password = input2;
connect.toDB();
if(check(username, password)){
setSessionID();
POST to a page with sessionID and Username.
} else {
echo “Bad Login”;
}

I haven’t had a look at the webclient for Minecraft, but I definately should.
if someone has the applet jar, mind posting it for me? (preferably unedited :))

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know how to make a webclient?

item.title: Anyone know how to make a webclient?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:4, topic:406610”][quote author=Wildyscape562 link=topic=503608.msg3684317#msg3684317 date=1311742865]
ive attempted to but i cannot find it anywhere in my minecraft.jar file i downloaded awhileback(its cracked)
[/quote]why dont you just steal notches webclient and crack it?[/quote]
Actually you don’t need to crack Notch’s webclient. The username and such are passed as paremeters. I had a working webclient a while back, but issues rose. When using a webclient, you cannot use mods, etc. The only real ‘trouble’ that is possible is setting up dynamic names lol. Again, really easy, and I had that done. The website I had this all hosted on is currently not paid for, but as soon as I feel like paying (when I have a use for the domain + host) I will post the link.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone know how to make a webclient?
item.dc:creator: @k4den k4den
item.description:
@k4den wrote:

you will need to sign the jar.
the reason it is happening is because it will be using System.getProperty(“user.home”) to find their home directory, so that it can open the appdata folder.

java needs permission to do this, as well as modify files when it is running as an applet, so you will need to sign the client to be able to allw it to do so, and the user will need to click run on the box that pops up with the certificate.

Read full topic
